title: Crataegus pruinosa
text:
Crataegus pruinosa is a species of <a href="Crataegus">hawthorn</a> known by the common name frosted hawthorn. It is native to a wide area of the eastern <a href="United%20States">United States</a> and southern <a href="Canada">Canada</a>, and is sometimes considered to be several species, rather than just one.
The pulp of the small fruits is edible.
Varieties.
The following varieties are recognized in the "<a href="Flora%20of%20North%20America">Flora of North America</a>" (2015):
